Portal 1 was groundbreaking, Portal 2 is amazing. After 7 years it's still one of my favourite games ever.

Serioulsy, this is one of the best games I've ever seen. The writing is leagues beyond anything from any medium, and while it may be a bit short, it's the perfect length for this adventure. If you felt ANYTHING when you played the first Portal, you need to play this.
I cannot think of any reason not to own this game of the year in my eye.

Shocked that I've not yet recommended Portal 2. It's great. It's Portal with an actual story. Granted at times it seems the devs opted to make things too simple in the single player campaign by painting arrows around the place, or making only one small patch of white portal-able wall shine against dull dark surroundings; but with the co-op addition (local splitscreen possible with a few tricks here and there) it's just brilliant!

I never thought Valve could top 'Portal', but they said they would, and the definitely did. Probably the funniest game of 2011, I can't actually fault any part of this game. If you haven't played this, or the original Portal, do yourself a favour and just give it a go. You won't regret it.

Although the ambiance is completely different from the first Portal, I really appreciated the different style of humor on display in this sequel. The characterization of GlaD0S, Cave Johnson, and Wheatley is brilliant.
Portal 2 does everything Portal 1 didn't do, great story line, great action, and lots of brain work, worth every cent
Such an amazing game. Awesome puzzles, hilarious characters and fantastic settings. drfinitely five stars.

A longer and funnier return to the world of Aperture Science. More puzzle goodness with character development and peek into the history of Apeture Science. Creative puzzles and environments and a smoother difficulty curve make this sequel shine even compared to the original. the free to download soundtrack is well fitting and not intrusive.
If you can find a partner for the Co-Op it's well worth going through that as well. It's a separate and different story than the single player and rewarding to accomplish.
Portal 2 is definitely one of the best games you must play before you die.
I really like the game, but I couldn’t find the stupid cake.

Don't worry guys, it's much more longer than the first... although it still doesn't take THAT long to pass... it also helps if you have someone to play co-op with (In case you didn't know, the co-op campaign is completely new and different from the single player one)

An enjoyable game with an enjoyable multi-player aspect.  The co-op is inventive, the single-player captivating, and both will have you locked in your seat for hours on end.  There is definite replay value- for the achievement hunter and puzzle-solver alike.  Did I mention there's co-op? Can you think with portals, or are you content thinking inside the box?  Time to break out...

My experiences with the Portal series are really worth remembering.

This game is what introduced me to Steam, my friend told me about Portal, and he told me it was on steam.

The hype of Portal 2 is really huge, due to it being a sequel to the original Portal, part of the Orange Box. Portal really hyped up the community with its portal mechanics (inspired by Narbacular Drop), sad to say it was really short, so the community demanded a sequel, which originates Portal 2.

First gameplay through Portal 2, puzzles are really confusing, requiring you to think outside the box. Luckily, either GLaDOS, Wheatly or Cave are there to hint the players to go through the puzzles. There are lots of new mechanics too, especially the paint mechanics (inspired by Tag: The Power of Paint). The story is good and its comedy won't bore you. The game has a well made narration, showing the good and bad sides of each character.

The other thing that hyped it up was the Coop mode. Portals alone are confusing enough, now we have two sets of portals waiting to solve tons of other puzzles provided. This mode requires lots of cooperation and teamwork, and also a keen eye on possible solutions. Portal 2 also provided lots of utilities for coop plays, like gestures to express emotions, ping to show stuff, or even timers to sync in movement.

Once singleplayer and coop was done, nothing else is able to be done besides repeating the stories or doing challenges. Until, Valve released the workshop. Portal 2 was associated with the Steam Workshop, giving players a chance to create their own maps with ingame tools and playing endless amount of maps created by other players. This revived the Portal 2 hype, having players back on the game, creating maps and playing maps. Some maps are insanely hard, some maps are for casual players who love to stroll and play around.

[u][b]Conclusion[/b][/u]
Puzzle SP/Co-op FPS game, challenging your mind to think outside the box while refreshing you with comedy and silly stuff. In-game Co-op features are well made. The workshop implementation also gives it a big boost, for players to come back and play new maps created everyday.

Portal 2 takes everything that was awesome in the original and makes it bigger and better. The campaign is longer and more in depth, story, variety and puzzle wise. In addition to that, Valve throws in arguably one of the best cooperative experiences that is equally as beefy. If you happen to be stuck playing with a mental retard, it is still a good cooperative experience. You have no excuse not to get this.
